definition: and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: I still heard them even in Asian dens and German gutters.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然听见了他们甚而在亚洲穴和德国天沟。

sentences.english: You are that has enticed even time calling in Tokyo "the labor cane" the woman?
sentences.chinese: 诱惑了甚而时间叫在东京“辛苦藤茎”妇女的您是？

sentences.english: Massive data dumps and even friendly online government portals are insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 大量的数据转储和甚而友好的网上政府门户是不足的。

sentences.english: Similar to line, shape may seem so elementary that it’s hardly even worth consideration.
sentences.chinese: 与线类似，形状可能看上去太基础了，甚而不值一提。

sentences.english: Some platers have even found advantages over CN-silver plating processes.
sentences.chinese: 有些电镀工甚而找到好处超过CN银镀层过程。

definition: so much so that/to the extent that/even
down to/up to/to such an extent as to .../also written 以至於|以至于[yi3 zhi4 yu2]
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
even/going as far as to/so much so that
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
not necessarily/may not turn out to be/maybe not
that being the case/then/in that case
